title: Pagla Dashu - পাগলা দাশু - Sukumar Ray - সুকুমার রায়
description:
সব জিনিয়াসরাই একটু আধটু ছিটগ্রস্ত হন। সুকুমার রায়ের পাগলা দাশু was no different! দাশু বা দাশরথি কিন্তু ঠিক পাগল নয়! তাঁর পাগলামির মধ্যে মিশে থাকে ক্ষুরধার বুদ্ধি যা অঙ্ক করার সময়ে বা সহপাঠীদের বোকা বানানোর সময়ে তীক্ষ্ণ হয়ে ওঠে!
দাশুর রচয়িতা সুকুমার রায়  ছিলেন আরেক পাগল! মাত্র ৩৬ বছরের জীবদ্দশায় তিনি আমাদের উপহার দিয়েছেন 'পাগলা দাশু', 'আবোল তাবোল', ''হজবরল'-এর মত কিছু অবিশ্বাস্য সৃষ্টি। 

মির্চি ৯৮.৩-এর বিশেষ নিবেদন সুকুমার রায়ের 'পাগলা দাশু।'
গল্পপাঠে ও মাস্টারমশাইয়ের চরিত্রে - দীপ।
গল্পের সূত্রধার ও অন্যান্য ভূমিকায় সোমক।
জনৈক সহপাঠী - সায়ক।
পাগলা দাশুর ভূমিকায় - অগ্নি।
শব্দগ্রহণ, আবহসঙ্গীত ও স্পেশাল এফেক্টসে - রিচার্ড।
পর্ব পরিচালনায় - টিম সানডে ননসেন্স।
পোস্টার পরিকল্পনা - টিম Asterisc.

title: Sampatti Samarpan (Rabindranath Tagore)
description: RJ Mir narrates the story of an old miser who makes a yaksha out of his own grandson. One of the greatest short stories of all times, this masterpiece has been brought to life by the acting of both Mir and the little Ishiraj Pal Choudhury (who plays Nitai)
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Guptodhan (Rabindranath Tagore)
description: RJ Mir takes you through this Tagore classic of a man's quest for gold, and where it leads him - when he has to make a choice between gold and life.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Kankal (Rabindranath Tagore)
description: RJ Sree plays the skeleton (Kankal) in this haunting tale a woman, who dies under tragic circumstances. She comes back to share her life story.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Monihara (Rabindranath Tagore)
description: This one is really spooky. If you have seen the Satyajit Ray film, you know what we are talking about, but listen for the sheer literary brilliance. RJ Mir narrates this classic tale of a lonely wife obsessed with her jewellery. What happens to the husband after she disappears?
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Saradindu Bandyopadhyay - Tungabhadrar Teere - Episode 03 Final Episode
description:
Mirchi 98.3 brings to you the epic romance, Tungabhadrar Teere! An immortal historical fiction by Saradindu Bandyopadhyay!

Raja Debray discovers Arjunbarma and Bidyunmala's affair. Arjunbarma is banished from Vijaynagar. Balaram also leaves with him. Arjunbarma and Balaram discover a troop of enemy forces who are trying to attack Vijaynagar. He returns to bring the news to King Debray.

Novel written by: Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay
Radio Adaptation: Godhuli Sharma

title: Tungabhadrar Teere by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay - Episode 02
description:
Mirchi 98.3 brings to you the epic romance, Tungabhadrar Teere! An immortal historical fiction by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay!

King Debray appoints Arjunbarma as the royal ambassador. Balaram tells Arjunbarma that he can manufacture a special type of cannon which will prove fruitful in battle. Princess Bidyunmala's attraction towards Arjunbarma increases but Arjunbarma exercises control. The both of them meet in secret.

title: Tungabhadrar Teere by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay - Episode 01
description:
Mirchi 98.3 brings to you the epic romance, Tungabhadrar Teere! An immortal historical fiction by Sharadindu Bandyopadhyay!

Princess Bidyunmala and Princess Monikonkona are aboard a ship bound for the powerful South Indian kingdom, Vijaynagar. A royal marriage awaits! Bidyunmala is betrothed to King Debray. Suddenly they spot a young man drowning in the river. He is rescued by another crew member Balaram.

title: Ekti Bhoutik Kahini (Prabhat Kumar Mukhopadhyay)
description: RJ Deep takes you through this eerie, supernatural story set in late 19th century Bengal.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: The Adventure Of The Empty House (Sherlock Holmes - Bangla)
description: Sherlock Holmes is back in action! Enjoy the action with RJ Mir, Deep and Richard.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Sherlock Holmes' The Final Problem (Bangla)
description: Holmes meets his match in Prof.Moriarty. RJs Mir, Somak and Deep narrate this classic tale. The Reichenbach Falls recreated by Richard.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Lohar Biscuit (Sarandindu Bandopadhyay)
description: Byomkesh investigates a case where his client is threatened after he discovers a murder in his house. RJ Mir is Byomkesh, RJ Deep is the narrator.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Saptarshi Aar Harano Bikel (Taradas Bandopadhyay)
description: Rj Deep narrates the story of Saptarshi's visit to an old house. On his short trip he meets people who lived in this house 100 years ago!
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Raater Maanush (Syed Mustafa Siraj)
description: RJ Deep describes what happens one night when an uncle and his nephew get on to a rickshaw. Eerie and funny at the same time.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Aranyak (Harinarayan Chattopadhyay)
description: Mir narrates a thrilling tale of a cheetah hunt. Close your eyes and walk deep into a forest in the dead of the night...
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Dhekur (Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay)
description: What happens when a Bengali babu discovers Aladin's magic lamp? He finds the genie, but genie has a strange condition before he fulfills any wish! Singer Srikanto Acharya reads the story for Mirchi's Children's Day special.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Koutor Bhoot (Shirshendu Mukhopadhyay)
description: Some ghosts trapped in a box. What happens when they are released from the box?! Discover singer Srikanto Acharya in a brand new avatar of a storyteller.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Prof Shonku O Ashchorjyo Putul
description: A thrilling sci-fi tale where set in Norway, where a scientist goes missing. A tale of intrigue and suspense, read by RJ Deep.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Ashareeri (Saradindu Bandopadhyay)
description: RJ Mir reads from a diary of a man who was obsessed with the invisible presence of a woman. This is one of Saradindu's Barada stories.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Buddhir Baire (Narayan Gangopadhyay)
description: Listen to RJ Deep's narration of how a man saves the life of his friend.  From the writer of Tenida stories, this one is a gem of a short story.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Maalkosh (Saradindu Bandopadhyay)
description: RJ Mir narrates this short tale of genies fascinated by Raag Maalkauns...they descend on earth to listen to a sitar recital. This is one of the writer's Baroda stories. Baroda - the ghost-hunter.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Prof Shonku O Egyptio Atanko (Satyajit Ray)
description: Deep takes you to Egypt, where Prof Shonku meets Dr Summerton (Mir). Prof Shonku receives a gift of a 4000 year old mummy. The mummy travels to Giridih with Shonku. For the rest of the story, do tune in.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Amar Dhaam (Harinarayan Chattopadhyay)
description: A classic tale of a haunted house and its inhabitants. Mir's narration and Richard's sfx are sure to give you goosebumps.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Kamraa Aar Amraa (Hemendra Kumar Roy)
description: Deep and Pushpal take you through an eventful train journey. Filled with chills and thrills of a classic ghost story.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Garstin Place'er Saheb Bhoot (Birendra Krishna Bhadra)
description: Birendra Krishna Bhadra, known for his Chandipath (Mahishasurmardini) was also an integral part of All India Radio, Kolkata - a legendary broadcaster, he was an actor-playwriter-scriptwriter - a versatile personality. Here is an an extract from one of his stories, read by Deep.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Prof Shonku O Haad (Satyajit Ray)
description: One of Prof.Shonku's short adventures - where a dinosaur comes to life! Listen for the truly eerie moments. Narrated by Mir.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Mangal - i Swargo (Satyajit Ray)
description: Satyajit Ray translated Ray Bradbury's Mars is Heaven. Here is the sci-fi tale which keeps you on the edge right till the end. RJs Mir, Deep and other members of the Mirchi team pitch in to create the right atmosphere for a truly remarkable narrative. Listen particularly for the soundscape created by DJ Richard.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Tarini Khuro O Betaal (Satyajit Ray)
description: Actor Paran Bandopadhyay - plays Tarini Khuro - the amiable uncle, created by Satyajit Ray, who regales everyone with his tales of adventure, first-hand encounters with ghosts and phantoms. Here is one such story - where Tarini befriends a 'skeleton'.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Guptadhan (Rabindranath Tagore)
description: This is one of the classic tales of suspense in Bangla literature, penned by Rabindranath Tagore for his short story collection "Galpaguchha". Narrated by Mir, this is a story of man's eternal quest for what is elusive and ephemeral. Richard has created the appropriate soundscape to give you the feeling of claustrophobia.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Abhiram (Satyajit Ray)
description: One of Ray's short stories - with a 'ghostly' twist in the tale. The tale of a master and his loyal servant Abhiram.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Adol Badol (Syed Mustafa Siraj)
description: Deep narrates this short story - introduced by Mir. A spooky experience of a man who goes for his morning walk.
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: A Perfect Murder (Bangla)
description:
Written by Stacy Aumonier (British writer 1877-1928), here is a perfect murder mystery, well almost. The Bengali translation has been narrated by Mir, with Deep playing the mastermind. The story is set in France, DJ Richard creates the appropriate background.

Translation & radio adaptation: Subarna Chakrabarti
Introduction : Deep
Narration : Mir
other voices - Labanya, Indrani

Background music & special effects : Richard
Overall direction : Indrani
author: Mirchi Bangla

title: Maroner Poreo (Gajendra Kumar Mitra)
description: A supernatural tale where a wife comes back to haunt her husband even after death. Read by Mir, Deep, Labanya.
author: Mirchi Bangla

description:
The first of the Holmes stories on Sunday Suspense, with Mir as Sherlock, Deep as Watson and actress Sreelekha Mitra as 'the Woman' Irene Adler.
